III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Updated treatment plans shall be completed at least once every 90 calendar
days following the initial treatment plan per licensing rules.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The agency did not request or require consultation.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on a review of the facility’s budget
and the agency financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
There were no CAPs submitted for the period under review. No additional issues
were noted by the Chief Administrator.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported feeling very supported by management, participating in
training, and feel that the agency is meeting the needs of the youths.
The children were observed; however they could not be interviewed as they are
non-verbal.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the agency occurred on 05/06/2025.
Observed the large play/activity room, bedrooms, kitchen, and bathrooms.
The facility was found to be clean, neat, and appropriate. There were no issues or
concerns noted.
3

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
